snippet: A group of civic buildings on York Avenue in the far East 70s included three model tenement complexes, a school, a library, a settlement house and a public bath.
abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column on unusual group of civic buildings around York Avenue in the far East 70s, which all served an area once called Little Bohemia; buildings in area, which become home to large influx of immigrants after the American Civil War, include three model tenement complexes, school, library, settlement house and a public bath.
lead_paragraph: A group of civic buildings on York Avenue in the far East 70s included three model tenement complexes, a school, a library, a settlement house and a public bath.

headline.seo: An Upper East Side Cluster of Civic Architecture
headline.main: A Helping Hand in Brick and Mortar
headline.print_headline: A Helping Hand in Brick and Mortar
